p: Jackie Smith is professor of sociology and activist-scholar at the University of Pittsburgh. She has authored or co-authored numerous works on global and local social movements, including Social Movements and World-System Transformation (2017, co-edited with Michael Goodhart, Patrick Manning, and John Markoff), Social Movements in the World-System: The Politics of Crisis and Transformation (with Dawn Wiest) and Social Movements for Global Democracy. From 2012 to 2020 she served as editor of the open access Journal of World-Systems Research. Smith is co-coordinator of Pittsburgh’s Human Rights City Alliance and serves on the national steering committee of the U.S. Human Rights Cities Alliance.
